creator: ogee@oldany.cz
text:
This bug is also in new version 2.0.59. We have compiled apr and apr-util from
the same package version. apr version is 0.9.12.

When we want to start apache, we can see:

$ /etc/init.d/httpd-rp start
Starting httpd-rp: Syntax error on line 110 of /etc/httpd/conf/httpd-rp.conf:
Cannot load /opt/httpd-rp/modules/mod_cgi.so into server:
/opt/httpd-rp/modules/mod_cgi.so: undefined symbol: apr_procattr_addrspace_set
                                                           [FAILED]

When we comment mod_cgi, apache start OK.

OS:
==
CentOS 4.3 (kernel: 2.6.9-34.0.2.ELsmp)
Seems to be an old issue where a symbol was added within apr 0.9.x, and your httpd is not contemporary with the loaded APR.
creator: covener@gmail.com
